tags.string: pubsub
{module:pubsub/subscription}
{module:pubsub/topic}
{module:common/util}
{string} Base URL for Pub/Sub API.
{array} Required scopes for Pub/Sub API.
module:pubsub
{object} options - [Configuration object](#/docs/?method=gcloud).
tags.name: options

tags.html:
var gcloud = require('gcloud')({
keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json',
projectId: 'my-project'
});

var pubsub = gcloud.pubsub();

description.full:
Google Cloud Pub/Sub is a
reliable, many-to-many, asynchronous messaging service from Google Cloud
Platform.

Note: Google Cloud Pub/Sub API is available as a Limited Preview and the
client library we provide is currently experimental. The API and/or the
client might be changed in backward-incompatible ways. This API is not
subject to any SLA or deprecation policy. Request to be whitelisted to use
it by filling the Limited Preview application form.
description.summary:
Google Cloud Pub/Sub is a
reliable, many-to-many, asynchronous messaging service from Google Cloud
Platform.
description.body:
Note: Google Cloud Pub/Sub API is available as a Limited Preview and the
client library we provide is currently experimental. The API and/or the
client might be changed in backward-incompatible ways. This API is not
subject to any SLA or deprecation policy. Request to be whitelisted to use
it by filling the Limited Preview application form.

tags.string: {object=} query - Query object.
tags.name: query

tags.string: {string=} query.pageToken - Page token.
tags.name: query.pageToken

tags.string: {number=} query.pageSize - Max number of results to return.
tags.name: query.pageSize

tags.string: {function} callback - The callback function.
tags.name: callback

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error from the API call, may be null.
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

tags.string: {module:pubsub/topic[]} callback.topics - The list of topics returned.
tags.name: callback.topics

tags.string:
{object} callback.nextQuery - A query object representing the next
    page of topics.
tags.name: callback.nextQuery
tags.description: • A query object representing the next page of topics.

tags.string:
{object} callback.apiResponse - The full API response from the
    service.
tags.name: callback.apiResponse
tags.description: • The full API response from the service.

tags.html:
// Get all topics.
pubsub.getTopics(function(err, topics, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
// If nextQuery is non-null, there may be more results to fetch. To do
// so, run pubsub.getTopics(nextQuery, callback);.
});

// Customize the query.
pubsub.getTopics({
pageSize: 3
}, function(err, topics, nextQuery, apiResponse) {});

description.full:
Get a list of the topics registered to your project. You may optionally
provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.
description.summary:
Get a list of the topics registered to your project. You may optionally
provide a query object as the first argument to customize the response.

tags.string: {string} name - Name of the topic.
tags.name: name

tags.string: {function=} callback - The callback function.
tags.name: callback

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error from the API call, may be null.
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

tags.string: {module:pubsub/topic} callback.topic - The newly created topic.
tags.name: callback.topic

tags.string:
{object} callback.apiResponse - The full API response from the
    service.
tags.name: callback.apiResponse
tags.description: • The full API response from the service.

tags.html:
pubsub.createTopic('my-new-topic', function(err, topic, apiResponse) {
topic.publish({
data: 'New message!'
}, function(err) {});
});

//-
// Note: For cases like the one above, it is simpler to use
// {module:pubsub#topic}, which will create the topic for you at the time you
// publish a message.
//-

description.full: Create a topic with the given name.
description.summary: Create a topic with the given name.

tags.string: {Error} If a Topic instance or topic name is not provided.
tags.description: If a Topic instance or topic name is not provided.

tags.string: {Error} If a subName is not provided.

{module:pubsub/topic|string} - topic - The Topic to create a
    subscription to.
tags.description: topic - The Topic to create a subscription to.

tags.string: {string} subName - The name of the subscription.
tags.name: subName

tags.string: {object=} options - Configuration object.
tags.name: options

tags.string:
{number} options.ackDeadlineSeconds - The maximum time after receiving
    a message that you must ack a message before it is redelivered.
tags.name: options.ackDeadlineSeconds
tags.description: • The maximum time after receiving a message that you must ack a message before it is redelivered.

tags.string:
{boolean} options.autoAck - Automatically acknowledge the message once
    it's pulled. (default: false)
tags.name: options.autoAck
tags.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled. (default: false)

tags.string:
{number} options.interval - Interval in milliseconds to check for new
    messages. (default: 10)
tags.name: options.interval
tags.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages. (default: 10)

tags.string:
{boolean} options.reuseExisting - If the subscription already exists,
    reuse it. The options of the existing subscription are not changed. If
    false, attempting to create a subscription that already exists will fail.
    (default: false)
tags.name: options.reuseExisting
tags.description:
• If the subscription already exists, reuse it. The options of the existing subscription are not changed. If
    false, attempting to create a subscription that already exists will fail.
    (default: false)

tags.string: {function} callback - The callback function.
tags.name: callback

tags.html:
//-
// Subscribe to a topic. (Also see {module:pubsub/topic#subscribe}).
//-
var topic = 'messageCenter';
var name = 'newMessages';

pubsub.subscribe(topic, name, function(err, subscription, apiResponse) {});

//-
// Customize the subscription.
//-
pubsub.subscribe(topic, name, {
ackDeadlineSeconds: 90,
autoAck: true,
interval: 30
}, function(err, subscription, apiResponse) {});

//-
// Create a subscription to a topic from another project.
//-
var anotherProject = gcloud.pubsub({
projectId: 'another-project'
});

var topic = anotherProject.topic('messageCenter');

pubsub.subscribe(topic, name, function(err, subscription, apiResponse) {});

description.full:
Create a subscription to a topic. You may optionally provide an object to
customize the subscription.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error
occurred or a {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} object.
description.summary:
Create a subscription to a topic. You may optionally provide an object to
customize the subscription.
description.body:
Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error
occurred or a {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} object.

tags.string: {Error} If a name is not provided.
{string} name - The name of the subscription.
tags.name: name

tags.string: {object=} options - Configuration object.
tags.name: options

tags.string:
{boolean} options.autoAck - Automatically acknowledge the message once
    it's pulled.
tags.name: options.autoAck
tags.description: • Automatically acknowledge the message once it's pulled.

tags.string:
{number} options.interval - Interval in milliseconds to check for new
    messages.
tags.name: options.interval
tags.description: • Interval in milliseconds to check for new messages.

tags.string: {module:pubsub/subscription}

tags.html:
var subscription = pubsub.subscription('my-existing-subscription');

// Register a listener for message events.
subscription.on('message', function(message) {
// Called every time a message is received.
// message.id = ID used to acknowledge its receival.
// message.data = Contents of the message.
// message.attributes = Attributes of the message.
});

description.full:
Create a Subscription object in reference to an existing subscription. This
command by itself will not run any API requests. You will receive a
{@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} object, which will allow you to
interact with your subscription.
description.summary:
Create a Subscription object in reference to an existing subscription. This
command by itself will not run any API requests. You will receive a
{@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} object, which will allow you to
interact with your subscription.

tags.string: {Error} If a name is not provided.
{string} name - The name of the topic.
tags.name: name

tags.string: {object=} options - Configuration object.
tags.name: options

tags.string:
{boolean} options.autoCreate - Automatically create topic if it
    doesn't exist. Note that messages published to a topic with no
    subscribers will not be delivered. Default: true.
tags.name: options.autoCreate
tags.description:
• Automatically create topic if it doesn't exist. Note that messages published to a topic with no
    subscribers will not be delivered. Default: true.

tags.string: {module:pubsub/topic}

tags.html:
//-
// By default, it isn't required to specify a topic that already exists. The
// first time you publish a message, the topic will be created for you.
//
// This will only cost one additional API request at the time of publishing.
// If the topic doesn't need to be created, there is no performance penalty.
//-
var topic = pubsub.topic('my-topic');

topic.publish({
data: 'New message!'
}, function(err) {});

//-
// If you prefer an error when trying to publish to a topic that doesn't
// exist, set autoCreate to false.
//-
var nonExistentTopic = pubsub.topic('my-non-existent-topic', {
autoCreate: false
});

nonExistentTopic.publish({
data: 'New message!'
}, function(err) {
if (err) {
// API error from trying to publish a message to a non-existent topic.
}
});

description.full: Create a Topic object to reference an existing topic.
description.summary: Create a Topic object to reference an existing topic.

tags.string: {object=} options - Configuration object.
tags.name: options

tags.string:
{string|module:pubsub/topic} options.topic - The name of the topic to
    list subscriptions from.
tags.name: options.topic
tags.description: • The name of the topic to list subscriptions from.

tags.string: {number} options.pageSize - Maximum number of results to return.
tags.name: options.pageSize

tags.string: {string} options.pageToken - Page token.
tags.name: options.pageToken

tags.string: {function} callback - The callback function.
tags.name: callback

tags.string: {?error} callback.err - An error from the API call, may be null.
tags.name: callback.err
tags.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

tags.string:
{module:pubsub/subscription[]} callback.subscriptions - The list of
    subscriptions returned.
tags.name: callback.subscriptions

tags.string:
{object} callback.nextQuery - A query object representing the next
    page of topics.
tags.name: callback.nextQuery
tags.description: • A query object representing the next page of topics.

tags.string:
{object} callback.apiResponse - The full API response from the
    service.
tags.name: callback.apiResponse
tags.description: • The full API response from the service.

tags.html:
var callback = function(err, subscriptions, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
// If nextQuery is non-null, there may be more results to fetch. To do
// so, run pubsub.getSubscriptions(nextQuery, callback);.
};

//-
// Get all subscriptions for this project.
//-
pubsub.getSubscriptions(callback);

//-
// Customize the query.
//-
pubsub.getSubscriptions({
pageSize: 3
}, callback);

description.full:
Get a list of the subscriptions registered to all of your project's topics.
You may optionally provide a query object as the first argument to customize
the response.

Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error
occurred or an array of {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} objects.

To get subscriptions for a topic, see {module:pubsub/topic}.
description.summary:
Get a list of the subscriptions registered to all of your project's topics.
You may optionally provide a query object as the first argument to customize
the response.
description.body:
Your provided callback will be invoked with an error object if an API error
occurred or an array of {@linkcode module:pubsub/subscription} objects.

To get subscriptions for a topic, see {module:pubsub/topic}.

tags.string: {string} method - Action.
tags.name: method

tags.string: {string} path - Request path.
tags.name: path

tags.string: {*} query - Request query object.
tags.name: query

tags.string: {*} body - Request body contents.
tags.name: body

tags.string: {function} callback - The callback function.
tags.name: callback

description.full:
Make a new request object from the provided arguments and wrap the callback
to intercept non-successful responses.
description.summary:
Make a new request object from the provided arguments and wrap the callback
to intercept non-successful responses.
